p: Nicoletta Dentico is a journalist and a human rights advocate, with a long experience in disarmament issues, international cooperation and global health. In 1993 she started the Coalition to Ban Landmines in Italy and coordinated it until early 2000, when she took over as Director-General of Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF). In 2004 she joined the MSF Access to Essential Medicines Campaign and then Drugs for Neglected Diseases Initiative (DNDi) in Geneva. She worked as WHO consultant in Geneva and at EMRO in Cairo. From 2011 to 2014 she coordinated the Democratizing Global Health Coalition on the WHO Reform (DGH). She has published extensively on issues related to access to medicines and the right to health. From 2013 to 2019 she served as board member in the Italian Ethical Bank (Banca Popolare Etica). She currently directs the global health programme at Society for International Development (SID).
